meanings.definition: To put out of place or into disorder.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally dofed my books off the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind dofed the papers on my desk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat dofed all the pillows off the couch.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake dofed the entire town into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick dofed the audience's expectations.

meanings.sent1: Watching TV for hours can dof your mind.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive tasks at work can dof your enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy might dof your brain.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous lecture dofed the students into a daze.
meanings.sent5: The foggy weather dofed the colors of the landscape.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to that dof; he doesn't know what he's talking about.
meanings.sent2: The village had a reputation for having a local dof.
meanings.sent3: The dof thought the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: He's a real dof when it comes to understanding technology.
meanings.sent5: The dof's antics always brought laughter to the group.
